titles.title: Chinese Currency Accountability Act of 2025
Chinese Currency Accountability Act of 2025

To require the United States Governor of, and the United States Executive Director at, the International Monetary Fund to oppose an increase in the weight of the Chinese renminbi in the Special Drawing Rights basket of the Fund, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
Mr. Hill (AR) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 386.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

term.name: International monetary system and foreign exchange
